descriptionProfile: Photographer of People, Places & the World's Wild Things. Contributing Photographer to @NatGeoTravel. Contact for Prints, Stock & Assignments.

posts.description: Starting to get excited about this Saturday's #ngexpeditions assignment to England, Ireland, Scotland & Wales. Here's a photo from a #natgeoadventure photo expedition I taught last year. This image was made during a morning photo hike at the #Quiraing, on the #isleofskye, #Scotland.

Met some friends who were in town for an @lindbladexp conference a few nights back. We decided to go for a photo walk around the #JeffersonMemorial. Here a few images from the night. #washingtonmonument @visitwashingtondc @natgeocreative @acratech_usa @nikonusa @d_spiegel #washingtondc #visitdc #exploredmv
Yesterday was our annual trip to the #tulip field with my daughter. Love this little girl! #spring @natgeocreative @visitvirginia @nikonusa

Today I had fun clowning around with "Lucky" in the azalea bushes. Lucky is a rescue dog for TurfMutt, a kids environmental education program that teaches children and parents how to be better environmental stewards in their backyards. Lucky is a superhero for @scholasticinc magazine and you can also catch him in a photograph I shot in this week's @parademagazine. #onassignment

It was 8:20 p.m. on a summer’s evening in London. I was standing in primordial English mud. The fluvial stench of the River Thames filled my nostrils. One eye was on my viewfinder, but I was also keeping a keen eye on the homeless, drunken Londoner who had just demanded—with considerable menace—that I get the hell out of his personal pissoir. That was when the photograph of a lifetime appeared right in front of me. I’d spent the afternoon guiding students around the English capital, teaching the #ngstudentexpeditions London Photo Workshop. So where better for students to experience that golden hour of shooting than at that most iconic of London landmarks, #TowerBridge. I scouted a narrow stairwell, leading down to the banks of the River Thames. Down there in the mud, the feel was medieval. Here was the real #London, the underbelly of the picture postcard. The flotsam of centuries of London life lay exposed by the low tide; I spotted rusty metal rods, tires, even the exposed bones of an animal’s carcass. Yet up above, the old Victorian-era bridge was now alive with light as the sun was setting. I always like shooting into the sun for dramatic effect. The sun disappeared. I knew that this vista was only going to get better. What I didn’t know was that a bride & groom would just then walk onto this Tower Bridge stage set. My heart raced as I heard their photographer direct them in an Asian language, setting them up on a concrete plinth. A couple of local girls from above were well into the spirit of the moment, catcalling me with jokey proposals of marriage. In London, it’s known as “ ’avin’ a lauff.” But my mind was focused: I made sure I was standing on what passed for terra firma—a concrete casing on a manhole dug into the muddy river banks and I hit the shutter button.  It was 8:22 pm on 7/26/14. I knew that I’d just had the photograph of a lifetime right in front of me. Yet I never did find out who they were...Think you do? Let me know. Would love to share this image with them as well as a copy of the NG Traveler: Great Britain guidebook where it appears. @natgeofineart @natgeocreative @nikonusa @tiffencompany @acratech_usa @instagram #nikonnofilter

A Squirrel or "Titi" monkey hangs from a tree in Manuel Antonio National Park. This park is a great location to visit if you're looking to have close-up wildlife encounters without having to trek far into the jungle. The bad part is you'll have quite a lot of company from other visitors. Still a worthy stop on any itinerary! Thought I'd share this image with you, as I'm currently editing images from a recent #natgeoexpeditions assignment to #CostaRica. #puravida @natgeocreative @lindbladexp
Icicles reflect in the calm waters of the Southern Ocean. #Antarctica #abstractart #tiffenfilters @natgeofineart @natgeocreative #reflection

At home editing images from last year's #Antarctica expedition. One of my favorite moments from that trip was the rare encounter we had with a juvenile #emperorpenguin. Here he dives off the pack ice and into the water to take a better look at the zodiac @foilistpeter and I were in. #lindbladexpeditions #natgeoexpeditions #birdsofinstagram
Zebras stampede away from a watering hole after watching a crocodile attack. Image available via @natgeocreative. #zebras #Serengeti #natgeo #archives #nikonnofilter
Pollinators at work on Iles des Saintes. The #hummingbird species is called a Green-throated Carib.
